OuiShare Labs Camp #3

18 - 19 May 2015 at Mozilla Paris

Show me more!

Participative conference dedicated to open web technologies

OuiShare Labs Camp #3
  • Home
  • What?
  • Who?
  • Projects
  • Team
  • Location

Workshops & discussion clusters

The third edition of OuiShare Labs Camp brings together app and platform creators and service providers to discuss and work on ways to empower web users and give them back the ownership of their private data.

Migration formats

How to have a common way to describe an app and its data in the cloud? How to facilate migration of cloud softwre among service providers?

CryptoParty

Attend a CryptoParty to learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. People bring their computers, mobile devices, and a willingness to learn!

IndieWebCamp

Are you building your own website? Indie reader? Personal publishing web app? Or some other digital magic-cloud proxy? If so, come on by and join a gathering of people with like-minded interests.

Decentralized Sharing Working Group

How to offer the best user experience among free software? How do we manage to achieve interoperability with the tools we love?

Wikidata

How to work with wikidata and how to extend it to non-encyclopedic entities? How to make the use of Inventaire.io contribute back to wikidata?

Linked Data & Semantic Web

How can one build a distributed secure social web using only Web Standards such HTTP, TLS, Linked Data and JavaScript? As on previous occasions, we have Linked Data workgroup present in the Labs Camp!

You?

Interested in offering a workshop?
Write down a title, short description, problems you want to solve, and a list of other actors you'd like to work with,
and get in touch with us!

Speakers & Participants

Ben Werdmüller

Known / Elgg

Co-founder and CEO of Known, helping everyone publish to their own site. He has worked on open software for over a decade, co-founded Elgg, and was the first Geek in Residence at the Edinburgh Festivals.

Primavera De Filippi

Harvard Berkman Center

Research fellow at the Berkman Center for Internet & Society at Harvard Law School, Primavera is investigating the legal challenges of “governance-by-design” in online distibuted architectures, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum etc.

Henry Story

Co-Operating Systems

Studied philosophy at Kings College London, and Computing at Imperial College london. Worked at AltaVista on the BabelFish machine translation engine, Researched the Semantic Web at Sun Microsystems.

Erin Jo Richey

Known / Eidyia

Erin is Chief Experience Officer and co-founder of Known. Previously, she was an independent UX consultant, working on the design, architecture, and usability of products for startups and enterprises like eBay, Microsoft, and Intel.

Maxime Lathuilière

Inventaire.io / P2P-RM / OuiShare Labs

Walking the path toward an economy empowering citizens with open knowledge. • Prototyping Inventaire.io • #VRM #WebOfData #wikidata #JS

Jutta Steiner

Ethereum / Provenance

Nick Lambert

MaidSafe

Matan Field

La Zooz

Theoretical physicist and entrepreneur, dedicated to connect science and technology with society and humanities, economics and the environment.

Participating projects

  • All
  • Platform
  • Service
  • Hosting
  • Community

  • CozyCloud

    A Personal Cloud you can host, customize and fully control. Sync your contacts, calendars and files between your devices and your personal server. Add your own services to leverage your personal data.

  • IndieWebCamp

    The IndieWeb is a people-focused alternative to the 'corporate web'. Your content is yours. When you post something on the web, it should belong to you, not a corporation.

  • IndieHosters

    We are one place to manage your digital life. We offer a personal managed server for you, your familly or your organisation.

  • Sandstorm

    Sandstorm is an open source platform for personal servers.

  • Known

    Known is a simple, social publishing platform for your blog or website.

  • FreedomBox

    The FreedomBox is a personal server for your home, designed to give you back control over your identity, personal data, and communication.

  • RemoteStorage

    Develop your web app without worrying about hosting or even developing the backend for it, your users will connect their own backend at runtime.

  • La'Zooz

    La'Zooz is a Decentralized Transportation Platform that is owned by the community which turns vehicles' unused space into smart transportation solutions.

  • YunoHost

    YunoHost is a server operating system aiming to make self-hosting accessible to everyone.

  • Framasoft

    An association dedicated to promoting libre software. They also offer to unGoogle the Internet!

  • Olympe

    Solidarity and innovation. Free hosting service without ad and web applications.

  • Internet's Brique

    build together a free, neutral and decentralised Internet

  • LibreBoard

    LibreBoard is an open-source kanban board that let you organize things in cards, and cards in lists. You can use it alone, or with your team and family thanks to our real-time synchronisation feature. Libreboard is a land of liberty and you can implement all sort of workflows on it using tags, comments, member assignation, and many more.

  • Inventaire

    Interconnected inventories of books powered by wikidata, looking to become a resource mapper powered by open knowledge and the web of linked open data.

  • MaidSafe

    MaidSafe's distributed platform enables the creation of fast and secure applications that help ensure digital privacy, security and freedom for all.
